Package ca.cgjennings.ui.text

Class WordTokenizer

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.text.Tokenizer
ca.cgjennings.ui.text.WordTokenizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<WordTokenizer.WordResult>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpellCheckTokenizer
public class WordTokenizer extends Tokenizer implements Iterable<WordTokenizer.WordResult>
A base Tokenizer that tokenizes on word boundaries. Override tokenizeWord(java.lang.String, int, int) to decide how to tokenize each word, otherwise each word is highlighted by default.

    • WORD_PATTERN

      public static final Pattern WORD_PATTERN
      The default regular expression for finding words. The word found must be the first capture group.

    • retokenize

      protected void retokenize​(int start, int end)
      Overrides:

    • tokenize

      protected void tokenize​(int start, int end)
      Description copied from class: Tokenizer
      Retokenize at least the indicated region of the document. The tokenizer may choose to extend the region to be tokenized up to the entire document, if needed, for context.

      For each token found, the tokenizer should call Tokenizer.markToken(int, int).

      Overrides:
      tokenize in class Tokenizer
      Parameters:
      start - the start offset in the document
      end - the end offset in the document

    • tokenizeWord

      public void tokenizeWord​(String word, int start, int end)

    • getWordAtOffset

      public WordTokenizer.WordResult getWordAtOffset​(int position) throws BadLocationException
      Return the word at position, or null if there is no word (as defined by the tokenizer) at that offset in the document.
      Parameters:
      position - the offset into the document to check
      Returns:
      the word at position, or null
      Throws:
      BadLocationException - if the position is invalid

    • getWordRegex

      protected Pattern getWordRegex()
      Return the regular expression that should be used to split text into words. Group 1 must contain the word.
      Returns:
      the pattern to use for word splitting

    • collapseRangeToElement

      protected boolean collapseRangeToElement()
      When this method returns true, as it does unless it is overidden, the tokenizer will automatically reduce the context for parsing to the second-level elements that contain the range of the edit. For a PlainDocument, this means that only the line(s) affected by an edit will be retokenized. If this method returns false, edits will cause the entire document to be retokenized.

      You may override this in a subclass if you require additional context, or you can override tokenize(int, int) for fine-grained control of context and tokenization.

      Returns:
      true if retokenization should only affect modified lines

    • iterator

      public Iterator<WordTokenizer.WordResult> iterator()
      Iterate over the word tokens in the document.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<WordTokenizer.WordResult>
      Returns:
      an iterator over the document words

    • iterator

      public Iterator<WordTokenizer.WordResult> iterator​(String text)
      Iterate over the words in a String using the same definition of word as that used by the tokenizer.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to iterate over
      Returns:
      an iterator over the given text's words
